bill.title: Relative to the removal of certain information from the New Hampshire state police website.
bill.description: Relative to the removal of certain information from the New Hampshire state police website.

history.action: Introduced 01/05/2022 and referred to Criminal Justice and Public Safety
Public Hearing: 01/14/2022 01:30 pm Legislative Office Building 202-204
Executive Session: 03/02/2022 10:00 am Legislative Office Building 202-204
Committee Report: Inexpedient to Legislate (Vote 10-7; Regular Calendar)
Inexpedient to Legislate: Motion Adopted Voice Vote 03/16/2022 House Journal  7

calendar.description: Criminal Justice and Public Safety Public Hearing
Criminal Justice and Public Safety Executive Session

bill.full_text: the state police intrastate misdemeanors recorded removal of information amend rsa to read as follows intrastate misdemeanors recorded the division of state police shall record and update on its computer system on a daily basis the names of all persons for whom there are outstanding arrest warrants for misdemeanors in this state along with a statement of all arrest warrants for misdemeanors each person has pending the information recorded shall be made available upon request to all local and state law enforcement agencies and officers the department of safety and its employees and agents shall not be held liable for errors of omission or commission in the recording and maintenance of this information unless the error is shown to be the result of gross negligence or an intentional act upon request of the person arrested the state police shall update its computer system and public internet website by removing any arrest record of such person for which the charges have been nol prossed or dismissed the state police intrastate civil and criminal recorded removal of information amend rsa to read as follows intrastate civil and criminal recorded the division of state police or its designee may record and update on its computer system on a daily basis the name of any person for whom there is an outstanding arrest warrant or capias issued for criminal or civil including failure to appear in connection with child support enforcement proceedings the information recorded shall be made available upon request to all local and state law enforcement agencies and officers the department of safety and its employees agents and designees shall not be held liable for errors of omission or commission in the recording and maintenance of this information unless the error is shown to be the result of gross negligence or an intentional act upon request of the person arrested the state police shall update its computer system and public internet website by removing any arrest record of such person for which the charges have been nol prossed or dismissed
